basics.name: Ralph Uy
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2026. I am currently leaning toward a greater focus on cybersecurity for my career.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI
courses: ICS 111 - Intro to Computer Science I
ICS 211 - Intro to Computer Science II
ICS 355 - Security and Trust I: Resource Protections

work.summary: Full time employee tasked to ensure workplace safety for both patients and staff.
highlights: Maintain a safe workplace by searching and securing contrabands.
Patrol the facility to enforce zero trespassing.
Observe and report incidents through use of security cameras.

work.summary: Project Intern under ESnet's project CD06 - Finding New Data Visualizations for ESnetâ€™s Network Flow Data.
highlights: Managed data by obtaining raw tables, cleaning up using sorting and pandas in Python.
Created new visualizations of data using graphs that haven't been used prior with Seaborn and Matplotlib.
Presented as a team to Berkeley's Director of K-12 STEM Education Programs, Project manager, Berkeley staff, and other interns

work.summary: Employee under FOH (Front of House) crew which primarily entailed welcoming customers, serving food, accepting payments, and maintaining the cleanliness of food and dining area.
highlights: Team coordination and communication was of utmost importance in order to work in an efficient and timely, but safe manner.
Cleaned the entire restaurant after every shift.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: Best in Category: Systems Software
awards.awarder: Windward Academy for Career and Technical Education
awards.summary: We won first place in my science fair project for the districts division. This allowed us to advance to the State science fair level.

awards.title: Hawaii State Science and Engineering Fair Project Winner
awards.awarder: UH Manoa College of Engineering, Dr. Song K. Choi
awards.summary: We were given the opportunity to present our science fair project as highschool students alongside other college students from the UH Manoa College of Engineering. Came with a cash reward of $300.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Earned a semester grade point average of 3.8+.
